attributes.action: Review of the national profile for Band 2 Agenda for Change Phlebotomist role.
attributes.additional_details: Phlebotomists play a vital role in patient care and the efficient running of healthcare services. They perform a skilled procedure, ensuring samples are taken safely, accurately, and respectfully. Phlebotomists perform venepuncture that the majority of nurses and doctors are not competent (or expected) to perform. The current Band 2 profile does not reflect the complexity or demands of practice.  These expectations exceed the scope of a Band 2 role as currently defined under Agenda for Change.
attributes.background: Review and update the national Band 2 Phlebotomist profile, with a view to re-banding to Band 3 or higher, in line with comparable clinical responsibilities. The role demands skill and responsibility - phlebotomists deserve fair pay and recognition that reflect their vital contribution to the NHS.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about banding are a matter for the NHS, not the UK Government or Parliament.
